qas.question: How many future popes did Paul VI create first as cardinals?
Who was made a cardinal by Paul VI on June 27 1977?
What future pope was made a cardinal by Paul VI on June 26, 1967?
In what year did Paul VI die?
What name did Albino Luciani take as a pope?

context: The next <a0_0>three<a0_0/> popes, including Pope Emeritus Benedict XVI, were created cardinals by him. His immediate successor, Albino Luciani, who took the name <a4_0>John Paul I<a4_0/>, was created a cardinal in the consistory of 5 March 1973. <a2_0>Karol Wojtyła<a2_0/> was created a cardinal in the consistory of 26 June 1967. <a1_0>Joseph Ratzinger<a1_0/> was created a cardinal in the small four-appointment consistory of 27 June 1977, which also included Bernardin Gantin from Benin, Africa. This became the last of Paul VI's consistories before his death in August <a3_0>1978<a3_0/>. Pope Paul was asked towards the end of his papacy whether he would retire at age 80, he replied "Kings can abdicate, Popes cannot."[citation needed]
